h100.gross_margin: N/A (Industry estimates suggest very high margins, potentially >70%+)

cost_breakdown.silicon: N/A (Dominant cost, complex CoWoS packaging significant)
cost_breakdown.packaging: N/A (CoWoS-S packaging is a major cost driver)

a100.manufacturing_cost: N/A (Lower than H100 due to mature node/package)

mi300x.manufacturing_cost: N/A (Estimated high due to complex MCM design & packaging)

arc_gpu.comment: Specific cost data for Intel Arc datacenter GPUs (e.g., Falcon Shores) in 2024-2025 is not publicly available. Consumer Arc costs are lower but not relevant to this H100/A100/MI300X tier.

industry_analysis.average_gross_margin: High (Estimated 60%+ for leading datacenter GPUs, varies by company/product)
industry_analysis.cost_trend: Increasing (Driven by advanced nodes (N3, N2), complex packaging (CoWoS, 3D), and rising wafer prices)
industry_analysis.main_cost_driver: Advanced Packaging (CoWoS, 3D stacking) & Foundry Node (TSMC N4P/N5 for H100/MI300X, moving to N3/N2)

data_caveats: Manufacturing costs are closely guarded trade secrets. Public figures are estimates from analysts (e.g., TechInsights teardowns) or inferred calculations.
Retail prices vary significantly based on volume, vendor markup, configurations, and market dynamics.

Gross margins are not explicitly broken out per GPU SKU in financial reports. Figures are broad estimates based on company financials (NVIDIA's overall Data Center gross margin ~75%) and industry analysis.
R&D allocation per unit is highly dependent on sales volume and amortization periods, not publicly disclosed.
TSMC/Samsung foundry pricing is confidential. Known trends: prices for advanced nodes (N3, N2) and packaging (CoWoS) are high and increasing.
